metadata.title: CVE-2017-9991 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the xwd_decode_frame function inlibavcodec/xwddec.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.12, 3.0.x before 3.0.8, 3.1.xbefore 3.1.8, 3.2.x before 3.2.5, and 3.3.x before 3.3.1 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.2.6-1
libav-tools - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.2.6-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.2.6-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.2.6-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.2.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.2.6-1').
